intro: Gastrolobium alternifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, zigzagging stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces yellow pea-like flowers, which are typically borne in clusters. It is often found in sandy or gravelly soils in arid and semi-arid regions. Gastrolobium alternifolium is well adapted to drought conditions and can thrive in poor soil environments.
